novel_info.title: Ukraine war: Geneva talks with Kyiv 'most productive we've had so far in this process', Rubio says - BBC News

hierarchical_summary.overall_summary: Delegations from Ukraine, European allies and the US have been holding talks in Geneva on a draft peace plan. Here's a brief look at what's been happening: The proposals Nothing has been officially released, but both Ukraine and Russia have received a draft 28-point plan aimed at ending the war - Trump has reportedly suggested he wants Ukraine to agree to it by Thursday Putin has said the plan could form the basis of an agreement, but Ukraine and its European allies have expressed concerns A group of US senators said they were told the document was authored by Russia - which was denied by US Secretary of State Marco Rubio Trump lashes out at Ukraine and Europe During the afternoon, Trump posted on social media accusing Ukraine of expressing "zero gratitude" and criticising Europe for continuing to buy Russian oil Zelensky has since posted on social media thanking the US and Trump personally, and reiterated his argument that there must be a "dignified peace" Update from the talks Giving a brief update, Rubio said the US and Ukrainian teams had held the "probably best meeting" since Trump returned the office He said "changes" are now being made to the proposals and that he expects to provide a further update this evening - the Ukrainian delegation has also said further talks are due to take place
